title: Encouragement to Faithfulness
shortSummary: In 2 Timothy chapter 1, the Apostle Paul encourages Timothy to remain steadfast in faith and to rekindle the spiritual gift given to him. Paul emphasizes the power, love, and sound mind that God provides, urging Timothy to be unashamed of the gospel despite suffering. The chapter highlights the importance of faithfulness, remembrance in prayer, and reliance on God’s grace.
timeline: c. AD 66-67 - Paul’s imprisonment in Rome during his second imprisonment, shortly before his martyrdom

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle writing this letter from prison, encouraging Timothy to remain faithful and strong in the gospel.

keyCharacters.name: Timothy
keyCharacters.description: Paul’s beloved spiritual son and young pastor, recipient of the letter, exhorted to stir up his gift and endure suffering.

keyCharacters.name: Lois
keyCharacters.description: Timothy’s grandmother, noted for her sincere faith which was passed down to Timothy.

keyCharacters.name: Eunice
keyCharacters.description: Timothy’s mother, also commended for her genuine faith that influenced Timothy’s spiritual upbringing.

keyCharacters.name: Onesiphorus
keyCharacters.description: A faithful believer who refreshed Paul during his imprisonment and was not ashamed of Paul’s chains.

definitions.definition: Sincere, genuine faith that is not hypocritical or pretended, exemplified by Timothy’s family.
The spiritual gift given by God to Timothy, likely referring to his calling and abilities for ministry.
A mindset of timidity or cowardice opposed to the boldness and confidence God gives believers.
A disciplined, self-controlled, and sober mindset empowered by the Holy Spirit.
God’s divine call to salvation and service, not based on human works but on His purpose and grace.

outline.heading: Paul’s Greeting and Thanksgiving
outline.description: Paul opens with a formal greeting and expresses gratitude for Timothy’s sincere faith, which he traces back to his grandmother and mother, encouraging Timothy to remember his spiritual heritage.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Stir Up the Gift
outline.description: Paul urges Timothy to rekindle the spiritual gift given through the laying on of hands and reminds him that God has given a spirit of power, love, and self-discipline, not fear.

outline.heading: Call to Boldness in Suffering
outline.description: Timothy is encouraged not to be ashamed of the gospel or Paul’s imprisonment but to share in suffering for the gospel’s sake, trusting in God’s calling and grace revealed in Christ.

outline.heading: Charge to Hold Fast and Guard the Gospel
outline.description: Paul instructs Timothy to hold firmly to the sound teaching he received and to guard the entrusted gospel through the Holy Spirit dwelling in believers.

outline.heading: Faithfulness and Desertion
outline.description: Paul contrasts those who have deserted him in Asia with Onesiphorus, who faithfully sought Paul out and ministered to him, highlighting the blessing of faithfulness.

application: Regularly remember and give thanks for the sincere faith of those who have influenced your spiritual life, just as Timothy was reminded of his mother and grandmother’s faith.
Actively rekindle and use the spiritual gifts God has given you through prayer and faithful service, refusing to be controlled by fear.
Embrace suffering for the gospel with boldness and confidence, knowing God’s calling and grace sustain you.
Hold firmly to sound doctrine and guard the truth entrusted to you by relying on the Holy Spirit’s power.

keyVerses.text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reminds believers that God empowers them with courage, love, and self-control, not fear.

keyVerses.text: Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes salvation and calling as acts of God’s grace and purpose, independent of human effort.

keyVerses.text: Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
keyVerses.significance: This verse calls for steadfast adherence to true doctrine grounded in faith and love.

keyVerses.text: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.
keyVerses.significance: Paul’s confidence in Christ’s faithfulness encourages believers to endure suffering without shame.
